text:
The module system of JDK9 renders Ant's reflection hack that was introduced for bug 51668 useless. So again it is no longer possible to use extensions when running XSLT transforms in an environment that sets a SecurityManager - like an IDE.

I've asked for advice on the OpenJDK core libs list: http://mail.openjdk.java.net/pipermail/core-libs-dev/2016-August/043188.html
creator: bodewig@apache.org
bodewig@apache.org
text:
The JDK issue has been fixed with JDK9 build 136.

Together with git commit 7e55fea junitreport now works out of the box, people will need to enable a feature for <xslt>. I'll document the necessary step.

Fixed in 1.9.8 and 1.10.0.
